alert.note: Alert for Sherman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 8:24PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Sherman County through 815 PM MDT... At 724 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southeast of Ruleton, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Sherman County. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 0 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
